text: Alene Bertha Duerk (March 29, 1920 - July 21, 2018) was a United States Navy admiral. She was born in Defiance, Ohio. She became the first female admiral in the U.S. Navy in 1972. She was also the director of the U.S. Navy Nurse Corps from 1970 to 1975. She was a 1974 recipient of a Distinguished Alumni Award of Case Western Reserve University's Frances Payne Bolton School of Nursing. Duerk died in Lake Mary, Florida on July 21, 2018 at the age of 98. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:American military personnel of the Korean War Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:Military people from Ohio
title: Alene Duerk
